location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 3154 of 1840 from Colonel David Barr, Military Auditor General, Lieutenant-Colonel Thomas Dickinson, Chief Engineer at Bombay, and Lieutenant-Colonel George Moore, Member of the Military Board, Bombay, to Sir James Rivett Carnac, Baronet, Governor and President in Council, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is a response to a request for recommendations on the extent repairs should be made to the defences of the Island of Karrack [Khārk, Jazīreh-ye]; the authors draw attention to the report submitted on the matter in their address No. 700 of 14 September 1839 (see ff 2-21), and some of the recommendations made within. It also recommends the replacement of the late Lieutenant Charles Walker with an experienced engineer.
